newsitem.title: USA: Integrated to consolidate Diab, take charge.
newsitem.headline: Integrated to consolidate Diab, take charge.

text.p: Integrated Systems Inc said Tuesday it agreed to a deal with executives of a previously acquired firm, Diab Data Inc, which calls for it to make a one-time payment in exchange for termination of future payments Integrated Systems was to make through December 1998.
The company said it will take a one-time pretax charge of approximately $5 million during the current quarter, ending November 30, 1996, to cover these payments and related costs.
Integrated said this restructuring will allow it to begin consolidating the results of Diab Data rather than continuing to treat Diab Data results on an equity basis.
Previously, Diab Data revenue and income were not included in Integrated Systems' operating results.
Integrated stock gained two to 19-1/2 in early trading.
The company is a supplier of embedded software used to operate a variety of electronic products.
